title: Looking for someone to diagnose, report & provide analysis on DigitalOcean web server issues - Upwork
description: The task here is to diagnose, analyse and find the UNDERLYING ROOT issue that caused server to go down, database to go corrupted. Not fixing (but if you're good, maybe we will hire you to fix it too). I have a DigitalOcean server with Wordpress website and for past few weeks we've been experiencing lots of turbulence. We had few people fixing the issues, repairing database, but they couldnt diagnose what was the  UNDERLYING issue. I will share the details what they said, and would like you to try to diagnose whats the actual issue so it doesnt happen again. There were thoughts of past people who were fixing server: "i think there's only one reason for apache to crash. that is traffic" -- not true, our traffic isnt increasing and no spikes have been detected. This is what he fixed: "So as i told you earlier I have optimized PHP-FPM pool processes and Apache MPM module you can get more details from https://medium.com/@sbuckpesch/apache2-and-php-fpm-performance-optimization-step-by-step-guide-1bfecf161534" This was what other person said as a root issue: "Apache was crashing because child processes were exceeding the default limits, which I adjusted and enhanced and hence processes were able to make connections to the database. This was the root cause which I fixed" This is our main question: "Considering that there was no sudden increase or spike of traffic and for the past 3 months there were no server crashes, without any other changes, why were the apache modules causing this problem suddenly if this has never happened before?" I attached log screens they sent before, and our website uptime. Digitalocean login access details i will provide under request. We want to identify the issue - if we need to fix something on the website - update, we want to know with confidence. that's the one thing causing issues, and not just spent time fixing wrong things. Let me know if you can help. Skills: Apache HTTP Server, DigitalOcean, Web Server, Database, PHP

title: comprehensive Course Management System (CMS) system - Upwork
description: This system will leverage modern technologies, including React.js for the frontend, a headless Moodle backend, and PostgreSQL database, hosted on DigitalOcean infrastructure. The system will provide a user-friendly interface for course creation, enrollment, content management, and assessment. OBJECT IVES • Develop a feature-rich platform for creating, managing, and delivering online courses with ease. • Integrate payment processing functionality to enable course monetization and facilitate secure transactions. • Implement robust user management features to support organizations of various sizes and structures. • Provide administrators with tools to monitor student enrollment, progress, and assessment results effectively. PROPOSED FEATURES • Course Management: Administrators can create, edit, and organize courses, sections, and quizzes. They can define course details,objectives, prerequisites, and pricing. • Payment Integration: Seamless integration with leading payment gateways such as Stripe, PayPal, or Square, allowing users to purchase courses securely using credit/debit cards or other payment methods. • User Management: Administrators can manage user accounts, roles,permissions, and organizational structure. They can create user groups,assign roles, and define access levels. • Enrollment Management: Users can enroll in courses, view course details,and track their progress. Administrators can monitor enrollment numbers,manage waitlists, and generate enrollment reports. • Content Management: Instructors can upload course materials, including documents, videos, presentations, and multimedia content. title: Additions and Fixes to Custom App - Upwork

En este módulo se tendrá la oportunidad de crear récord de cambios en “Fund Allocation” de manera que puedan ser distribuidos a los mecanismos de reportes actuales. Esta adición brindará mayor claridad en lo relacionado a datos históricos de las diferentes distribuciones realizadas y/o asignadas por la organización. Modificaciones al Reporte de Dashboards Se realizarán modificaciones al “Dashboard” de supervisores/administrativo actual. Las modificaciones nuevas expanden la capacidad de proveer porcientos de distribución (Fund Allocation) de manera que puedan ver el componente histórico. De este modo de haber un rango de fechas en el que el empleado estuvo remunerado por distintos fondos a lo actual, se podrán ver estos porcientos representados en la tabla principal de fondos. Si el rango de fecha incluye un periodo en el que las dos estructuras de distribución están presentes, estos porcientos serán incluidos en sus respectivos fondos. Se observará que la suma de las distribuciones no seráÃÅ equivalente a 100% en este caso en particular ya que hay conflicto de distribución en cuanto al “Target Allocation” (Tar. %) y el rango de fecha seleccionado. Modificaciones al Reporte de Exporte CSV Se desarrollarán varias modificaciones al reporte de exporte CSV para que incluya la distribución correspondiente al registro (i.e. entrada - FTE Time Entry) con respecto al “Target % Allocation” que estaba vigente en el rango de fechas en el que se registró la entrada. Modificaciones al Registro de Entrada Se estarán realizando las modificaciones necesarias para incluir la fecha en que se registra una entrada como parte de la información del mismo registro. De tal manera, se incluirá esta fecha en los reportes de CSV para poder utilizar este campo en reportes externos. Nota: para los registros viejos este escaño quedara “nulo” (vacío). Función de Impresión para todos los Reportes de Empleados Creación de una funcionalidad para que al momento en que el administrador del sistema tenga que imprimir varios reportes a la vez, no tenga que ir uno a uno, es decir empleado por empleado, creando reportes individuales. De esta manera se podrán “queue” los reportes para los empleados seleccionados y todos estos terminarían encasillados en una sola operación. El motivo de esta modificación está en regresarle el tiempo que toma en crear todos estos reportes para la organización completa. Los usuarios administradores serán excluidos. Creación de un Salary Log Creación de módulo interno para poder obtener datos históricos con respecto a la fluctuación de salarios por empleado. En este módulo el administrador tendrá la oportunidad de crear récord de cambios de manera que puedan ser distribuidos a los mecanismos de reportes actuales. También se corregirá la fórmula que compone los salarios anualizados. Creación de campo de usuario Activo / Inactivo Creación de un campo para distinguir a usuarios activos y los que ya no son parte de la organización (inactivos). Here is the description:   "Interface specification at web service level: This chapter describes the basic technical agreements. The data between between the system and the SAP ERP system is exchanged via the SAP PI/PO system as the central middleware. 1. Message protocol and transport protocol - The message protocol is SOAP 1.2, the transport protocol is http or https 2. Encoding message protocol - The message protocol encoding is UTF (content type "text/xml; charset=utf-8") 3. Access control, authentication and encryption 3.1. System - SAP PI/PO - All communication between the systems is realised via an IPSec tunnel. - Access control is guaranteed by an IP-based access control list - Encryption of the connection is additionally guaranteed via SSL and reinforced by : - A web service does not respond to an unencrypted request from a consumer - Authentication takes place via HTTP Basic Authentication. 3.2 SAP ERP system - SAP PI/PO - Communication between the SAP interface applications is implemented via the ABAP proxies - All communication takes place via an SAP HTTP RFC (SAP_PROXY_ESR) - Authentication takes place via an RFC user (PIUSER) known on both sides - The respective SAP system landscape (SAP ERP & SAP PI/PO) each has a three-level characteristic (system type: DEV, QAS and PROD) and communication is implemented specifically according to SAP ERP system type - SAP PI/PO system type Web service contract/WSDL contract - The WSDL files for the interfaces of the systems involved have a generic structure and include every possible possible parameters for all operational purposes (input/output). - Table-specific data (e.g. a list of articles) is transferred using namespaces and parameter schemas such as Table-style data (e.g. list of articles) and a "Param.RowNum.ColumnName" scheme (e.g. "Articles.0.ID", "Ar[1]ticles.1.Name", "Articles.1.ID", "Articles.1.Name" ... "Articles.N.ID", "Articles.N.Name") Web services between the SAP systems are realised on the basis of ABAP proxies" If you meet these qualifications and are excited about the opportunity to work on challenging projects involving web service interfaces and SAP integration, we encourage you to apply.Skills: SAP Adaptive Server Enterprise, API, SAP, SAP Business Warehouse, ABAP, ERP Software, Python, .NET Framework, HTML

title: Write Software for A Custom Proxy Network - Upwork
description: Hi, I am interested in building a custom 4G proxy network. Looking for a skilled programmer to write the necessary code to make this possible. Here is a basic description of what I’m trying to achieve: A proxy farm is a setup where multiple proxies are used to provide a larger number of IP addresses for use with various online activities such as web scraping, social media management, and SEO. The basic idea is to have a large pool of IP addresses that can be used to rotate through different tasks. A proxy farm typically includes the following components: * A server or cluster of servers: These servers host the proxy farm and manage the IP addresses. * Proxies: These are the IP addresses that are used to connect to the internet. They can be purchased or leased from a proxy provider, or they can be created by the proxy farm administrator. ** Software: Specialized software is used to manage the proxies, assign them to specific tasks, and rotate through them. This software can be custom-built or purchased from a third-party provider** Here is a general workflow of how it works: 1. A user or application requests access to a website or service through the proxy farm 2. The proxy farm software assigns an available proxy from the pool of IP addresses to the request 3. The request is sent to the website or service using the assigned proxy IP address 4. The response is received and passed back to the user or application 5. The proxy IP address is rotated and added back to the pool of available IP addresses, ready for the next request If this is something you think you may be able to help with, I'd love to hear from you. Thanks.Skills: Python, Linux, Linux System Administration, VPN, Web Proxy
